concepts.concept_name: Types of sets: finite, infinite, empty, equal, equivalent, universal, and power set
Set operations: union, intersection, difference, symmetric difference, and complement with Venn diagrams
Laws of algebra of sets: De Morgan's laws, distributive, associative, and commutative laws
Cartesian product of sets and ordered pairs; relations as subsets of A x B

in_scope: Roster and set-builder notation
Subset, proper subset, and superset
Power set and its cardinality: |P(A)| = 2^n
Union, intersection, difference, complement operations
Venn diagrams for two and three sets
De Morgan's laws: (A U B)' = A' ∩ B' and (A ∩ B)' = A' U B'
Cartesian product A x B and ordered pairs
Domain and range of a relation
Types of relations: reflexive, symmetric, transitive
out_of_scope: Equivalence relations and equivalence classes (Covered in Class 12)
Infinite set cardinality and countability (Beyond ICSE scope)
Axiomatic set theory (Beyond ICSE scope)

concepts.concept_name: Definition of a function, domain, co-domain, and range
Types of functions: one-one (injective), onto (surjective), and bijective
Algebra of real-valued functions: (f + g)(x), (f - g)(x), (fg)(x), (f/g)(x)

in_scope: Function as a special type of relation
Determining whether a relation is a function
Finding domain and range of real-valued functions
Identifying injective, surjective, and bijective functions
Sum, difference, product, and quotient of functions
Graphical representation of functions
Real-valued functions: polynomial, rational, modulus, signum, greatest integer
out_of_scope: Composition of functions (Covered in Class 12)
Inverse functions (Covered in Class 12)
Continuity and differentiability of functions (Covered later in Class 11)

concepts.concept_name: Definition of complex numbers z = a + ib, real and imaginary parts, and the imaginary unit i = sqrt(-1)
Algebra of complex numbers: addition, subtraction, multiplication, and division
Modulus |z| and conjugate z-bar of a complex number and their properties
Argand plane representation and polar form of complex numbers

in_scope: i = sqrt(-1), i^2 = -1, powers of i
Standard form a + ib
Addition, subtraction, multiplication of complex numbers
Division using conjugate: (a+ib)/(c+id)
Modulus: |z| = sqrt(a^2 + b^2)
Conjugate: z-bar = a - ib
Properties: z * z-bar = |z|^2
Argand plane: plotting complex numbers
Polar form: z = r(cos(theta) + i*sin(theta))
out_of_scope: De Moivre's theorem (Beyond ICSE Class 11 scope)
Cube roots of unity (Beyond ICSE Class 11 scope)
Complex number geometry beyond Argand plane basics (Beyond ICSE scope)

concepts.concept_name: Quadratic equations with real coefficients and complex roots using discriminant analysis
Relation between roots and coefficients: sum = -b/a, product = c/a
Formation of quadratic equation given its roots

in_scope: Quadratic formula: x = (-b +/- sqrt(b^2 - 4ac)) / 2a
Discriminant D = b^2 - 4ac and nature of roots
Real roots when D >= 0, complex roots when D < 0
Sum of roots = -b/a, product of roots = c/a
Forming quadratic equation: x^2 - (sum)x + (product) = 0
Symmetric functions of roots
Equations reducible to quadratic form
out_of_scope: Higher degree polynomial equations (Beyond ICSE Class 11 scope)
Descartes' rule of signs (Beyond ICSE scope)
Basic quadratic factorisation (Covered in Class 10)

concepts.concept_name: Solving linear inequalities in one variable and representing solutions on the number line
System of linear inequalities in one variable
Linear inequalities in two variables and graphical solution in the Cartesian plane

in_scope: Properties of inequalities: adding, subtracting, multiplying, dividing
Reversing inequality sign when multiplying/dividing by negative
Solving ax + b < c, ax + b > c, ax + b <= c, ax + b >= c
Number line representation of solution sets
Solving systems of two linear inequalities in one variable
Graphing linear inequalities in two variables
Identifying feasible region for a system of inequalities
out_of_scope: Quadratic inequalities (Beyond ICSE Class 11 scope)
Absolute value inequalities (Beyond ICSE Class 11 scope)
Linear programming optimisation (Covered in Class 12)

concepts.concept_name: Fundamental principle of counting: multiplication and addition principles
Permutations: nPr = n!/(n-r)! and arrangements with and without repetition
Combinations: nCr = n!/[r!(n-r)!] and selection problems
Applications: word arrangement, committee formation, and constrained counting problems

in_scope: Factorial notation: n! = n x (n-1) x ... x 1, 0! = 1
Fundamental counting principle
nPr formula and its derivation
Permutations of distinct objects
Permutations with repeated objects: n!/(p!q!r!...)
Circular permutations: (n-1)!
nCr formula and properties: nCr = nC(n-r)
nCr + nC(r-1) = (n+1)Cr
Problems on committees, teams, and selections
out_of_scope: Permutations with restrictions beyond standard types (Beyond ICSE scope)
Derangements (Beyond ICSE scope)
Multinomial theorem (Beyond ICSE scope)

concepts.concept_name: Binomial theorem for positive integral index: (a + b)^n expansion
General term T(r+1) = nCr * a^(n-r) * b^r and middle term(s)
Properties of binomial coefficients and Pascal's triangle

in_scope: Statement of binomial theorem for (a + b)^n where n is a positive integer
Expansion using nCr notation
General term: T(r+1) = nCr * a^(n-r) * b^r
Finding specific terms in the expansion
Middle term: one middle term if n is even, two if n is odd
Pascal's triangle and binomial coefficient properties
Simple applications: finding coefficient of x^k in an expansion
out_of_scope: Binomial theorem for negative or fractional index (Beyond ICSE Class 11 scope)
Multinomial theorem (Beyond ICSE scope)
Binomial series convergence (Beyond ICSE scope)

concepts.concept_name: Arithmetic progression: nth term a_n = a + (n-1)d and sum S_n = n/2[2a + (n-1)d]
Geometric progression: nth term a_n = ar^(n-1) and sum S_n = a(r^n - 1)/(r - 1)
Sum to infinity of a GP when |r| < 1: S_inf = a/(1 - r)
Arithmetic mean (AM), geometric mean (GM), and the AM-GM inequality

in_scope: AP: nth term, sum of n terms, arithmetic mean
GP: nth term, sum of n terms, geometric mean
Sum to infinity for |r| < 1
Relationship: AM >= GM for positive numbers
Inserting n arithmetic means between two numbers
Inserting n geometric means between two numbers
Special sums: sum of first n natural numbers, sum of squares, sum of cubes
Word problems on AP and GP
out_of_scope: Harmonic progression (Beyond ICSE Class 11 scope)
Arithmetico-geometric series (Beyond ICSE scope)
Convergence tests for general series (Beyond ICSE scope)

concepts.concept_name: Principle of mathematical induction: base case and inductive step
Proving summation formulae using mathematical induction
Proving divisibility and inequality statements using mathematical induction

in_scope: Statement of the principle of mathematical induction
Step 1: Verify the base case P(1)
Step 2: Assume P(k) is true (inductive hypothesis)
Step 3: Prove P(k+1) using P(k)
Proving sum formulae: 1+2+...+n, 1^2+2^2+...+n^2, etc.
Proving divisibility: e.g., 4^n - 1 is divisible by 3
Proving inequalities: e.g., 2^n > n for n >= 1
out_of_scope: Strong induction (Beyond ICSE Class 11 scope)
Well-ordering principle (Beyond ICSE scope)
Structural induction (Beyond ICSE scope)

concepts.concept_name: Radian measure, degree-radian conversion, and arc length formula l = r*theta
Trigonometric functions for any angle: signs in four quadrants and allied angles
Compound angle formulae: sin(A +/- B), cos(A +/- B), tan(A +/- B)
Multiple angle formulae: sin 2A, cos 2A, tan 2A and sub-multiple angles

in_scope: Degree and radian measure: pi radians = 180 degrees
Arc length: l = r*theta (theta in radians)
Trigonometric ratios for all angles using unit circle
Signs of trigonometric functions in each quadrant (ASTC rule)
Allied angle formulae: sin(pi - theta), cos(pi + theta), etc.
sin(A+B) = sinA*cosB + cosA*sinB and related formulae
cos(A+B) = cosA*cosB - sinA*sinB and related formulae
tan(A+B) = (tanA + tanB)/(1 - tanA*tanB)
Double angle: sin2A = 2sinA*cosA, cos2A = cos^2A - sin^2A
Half-angle formulae derived from double angle
out_of_scope: Inverse trigonometric functions (Beyond ICSE Class 11 scope)
Trigonometric equations beyond standard types (Beyond ICSE scope)
Hyperbolic functions (Beyond ICSE scope)

concepts.concept_name: Various forms of equation of a line: slope-intercept, point-slope, two-point, intercept, and normal form
General equation ax + by + c = 0 and conversion between forms
Angle between two lines, distance of a point from a line, and distance between parallel lines
Family of lines passing through the intersection of two given lines

in_scope: Slope-intercept form: y = mx + c
Point-slope form: y - y1 = m(x - x1)
Two-point form: (y - y1)/(y2 - y1) = (x - x1)/(x2 - x1)
Intercept form: x/a + y/b = 1
Normal form: x*cos(alpha) + y*sin(alpha) = p
General form: ax + by + c = 0
Angle between two lines: tan(theta) = |m1 - m2|/(1 + m1*m2)
Distance of point (x1, y1) from line ax + by + c = 0: |ax1 + by1 + c|/sqrt(a^2 + b^2)
Distance between parallel lines
Condition for concurrency of three lines
out_of_scope: Pair of straight lines (Beyond ICSE Class 11 scope)
Homogeneous equations of second degree (Beyond ICSE scope)
Transformation of axes (Beyond ICSE scope)

concepts.concept_name: Circle: standard form (x-h)^2 + (y-k)^2 = r^2 and general form
Parabola: standard forms y^2 = 4ax and x^2 = 4ay with focus, directrix, and latus rectum
Ellipse: standard form x^2/a^2 + y^2/b^2 = 1 with eccentricity, foci, and latus rectum
Hyperbola: standard form x^2/a^2 - y^2/b^2 = 1 with eccentricity, foci, and asymptotes

in_scope: Definition of conic sections as intersection of cone and plane
Circle: centre-radius form and general equation
Finding centre and radius from general equation
Parabola: vertex, focus, directrix, axis, latus rectum
Four standard forms of parabola
Ellipse: major axis, minor axis, foci, vertices, eccentricity e = c/a
Relationship: c^2 = a^2 - b^2 for ellipse
Hyperbola: transverse axis, conjugate axis, foci, vertices, eccentricity
Relationship: c^2 = a^2 + b^2 for hyperbola
Latus rectum of parabola, ellipse, and hyperbola
out_of_scope: Tangent and normal to conics (Beyond ICSE Class 11 scope)
Parametric equations of conics (Beyond ICSE Class 11 scope)
Conjugate and rectangular hyperbola (Beyond ICSE scope)

concepts.concept_name: Coordinate axes and coordinate planes in 3D space; octants
Distance between two points in 3D: sqrt((x2-x1)^2 + (y2-y1)^2 + (z2-z1)^2)
Section formula and mid-point formula in three dimensions

in_scope: Three coordinate axes: x, y, z
Three coordinate planes: XY, YZ, XZ
Eight octants and sign conventions
Coordinates of a point in 3D space
Distance formula in 3D
Section formula: internal division in ratio m:n in 3D
Mid-point formula in 3D
Coordinates of centroid of a triangle in 3D
out_of_scope: Direction cosines and direction ratios (Covered in Class 12)
Equation of a line in 3D (Covered in Class 12)
Equation of a plane (Covered in Class 12)

concepts.concept_name: Intuitive idea of limits, left-hand and right-hand limits, and existence of a limit
Standard limits: lim(x->0) sin(x)/x = 1, lim(x->a) (x^n - a^n)/(x - a) = na^(n-1)
Algebra of limits and evaluation of limits using standard results and factorisation
Derivative as rate of change: first principle definition f'(x) = lim(h->0) [f(x+h) - f(x)]/h

in_scope: Intuitive understanding of limit of a function
Left-hand limit and right-hand limit
Limit exists when LHL = RHL
Algebra of limits: limit of sum, difference, product, quotient
Standard limit: lim(x->0) sin(x)/x = 1
Standard limit: lim(x->a) (x^n - a^n)/(x - a) = na^(n-1)
Evaluation by direct substitution, factorisation, rationalisation
Definition of derivative using first principles
Derivatives of x^n, sin(x), cos(x), tan(x), e^x from first principles
Rules: d/dx(f+g), d/dx(f-g), d/dx(fg) product rule, d/dx(f/g) quotient rule
out_of_scope: L'Hopital's rule (Beyond ICSE Class 11 scope)
Epsilon-delta definition of limit (Beyond ICSE scope)
Chain rule (Covered in Class 12)
Higher-order derivatives (Covered in Class 12)

concepts.concept_name: Measures of dispersion: range, mean deviation about mean and median
Variance and standard deviation for ungrouped and grouped data
Coefficient of variation and comparison of variability of two data sets

in_scope: Range = Maximum value - Minimum value
Mean deviation about mean: MD = (1/n) * sum|xi - x-bar|
Mean deviation about median
Mean deviation for grouped data (discrete and continuous)
Variance: sigma^2 = (1/n) * sum(xi - x-bar)^2
Standard deviation: sigma = sqrt(variance)
Shortcut formula: sigma^2 = (1/n)*sum(xi^2) - (x-bar)^2
Variance and SD for grouped frequency distributions
Coefficient of variation: CV = (sigma / x-bar) * 100
out_of_scope: Mean, median, mode computation (Covered in Class 10)
Quartile deviation and percentiles (Beyond ICSE Class 11 scope)
Skewness and kurtosis (Beyond ICSE scope)

concepts.concept_name: Random experiments, sample space, events, and types of events (mutually exclusive, exhaustive, complementary)
Axiomatic approach to probability and probability of an event
Addition theorem: P(A U B) = P(A) + P(B) - P(A ∩ B) and its applications
Problems on cards, dice, coins using set-theoretic approach

in_scope: Sample space as a set of all outcomes
Event as a subset of sample space
Types: impossible, sure, simple, compound events
Mutually exclusive events: A ∩ B = empty set
Exhaustive events: A U B = S
Complementary events: P(A') = 1 - P(A)
Axiomatic definition: 0 <= P(A) <= 1, P(S) = 1
Addition rule for two events
P(A U B) = P(A) + P(B) for mutually exclusive events
Problems involving playing cards, dice, and coins
out_of_scope: Conditional probability (Covered in Class 12)
Bayes' theorem (Covered in Class 12)
Probability distributions (Covered in Class 12)
Independent events multiplication rule (Covered in Class 12)
